alert.note: Alert for Morgan; Weld (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 13 at 10:31PM MDT until June 16 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Colorado... South Platte River near Weldona affecting Morgan and Weld Counties. South Platte River near Kersey affecting Weld County. ...The Flood Advisory is replaced with a River Flood Warning for the following rivers in Colorado... South Platte River near Balzac affecting Washington, Logan and Morgan Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...South Platte River near Weldona. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, The river is out of its banks and into fields and meadows. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.2 feet Wednesday morning, and then slowly recede through Thursday night and early Friday. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
